title: [K-12] Socially Shared Regulation in Science Classrooms: Collaborative and Self-Regulated Learning-Based Project Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational scientific knowledge and experience with collaborative learning
context.additional_context: Group-based science experiment projects using digital devices, strengthening self-regulation competencies through learner motivation and emotional sharing

learning_goals: Learners can monitor and regulate group motivation and emotional states using technological tools (digital devices) during collaborative processes.
Learners achieve a task completion rate of 80% or higher by applying self-regulated learning strategies (e.g., goal setting, feedback utilization) during project execution.
Learners can explain the importance of the socially shared regulation process in five or more ways through group discussions and reflective journaling.

resources: Real-Time Collaboration Platform (Google Workspace, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
